field.label: Fully qualified class names
field.tooltip: If set to Yes then the generated code will have `use` statements at the top of the classes and only use class aliases in the code. If it's set to No then the full class path will be used in the code.

field.label: Underscore for protected
field.tooltip: This does not apply for the methods and members that come from the core code.

field.label: Add annotations
field.tooltip: If set to yes, then the methods that are magically called from your classes will be added at the top of the class as reference.

field.label: License
field.tooltip:
The text you put here will be added at the top of (almost) each file in the module you create.
Use {{Namespace}} as a placeholder for namespace, {{Module}} as a placeholder for the module name and {{Y}} as placeholder for current year.
If you don't want any License text on your files just leave this field empty.

field.label: Namespace
field.tooltip: This is the folder name of your new extension. Your company name should go here. Use only letters and numbers. Start with a capital letter.

field.label: Module name
field.tooltip:
This is your extension/module name. It should be something meaningful and not very long.
Try to use a noun in singular form. Start with a capital letter.

field.label: Version
field.tooltip: This is the version of the module.

field.label: Admin menu title
field.tooltip: This is the title that will be added to the menu.

field.label: Admin parent menu ID
field.tooltip: This is the parent menu id of the module menu. Leave empty to add in top menu.
field.note: Select menu parent and position

field.label: Admin menu sort order
field.tooltip: This is the sort order in the menu.
field.note: Select menu parent and position

field.label: Label singular
field.tooltip:
Each entity must have a label used for buttons, links, messages.
This is the singular form of the label. For example in a blog module, the post entity will have the label in singular form 'Post'

field.label: Label plural
field.tooltip:
This is the plural form of the label above. It will be used for lists. (For example: 'Posts'). Try to use English words for this label. It's not mandatory, but it makes the taxonomy more readable. UMC will create a language file for the modules it generates and you can translate your module.
Info:I recommend the first letter to be uppercase.

field.label: Name singular
field.tooltip:
UMC generates the code in a 'human readable' form. It's easier to figure out what the code is about when the variables and methods have a propper name.
For example it's easier to read foreach ($_posts as $_post){...} or $_post->getTags() than foreach ($_list as $_item){...} or $_entity->getRelated('tags');
The value you fill in here will be used for variable names, file names and table names.

field.label: Name plural
field.tooltip: This is the plural value of the entity code. For example 'posts'.

field.label: Entity type
field.tooltip: This represents the entity behavior. Flat means one entity instance is mapped to a table row.

field.label: Behaves as tree
field.tooltip: If set to Yes your entity will have a tree behavior just like the catalog categories do.

field.label: Add 'Created at' to admin grid
field.tooltip:
The entities created with UMC will have a field called 'created_at' with the creation date of any entity instance.
If this is set to 'Yes' the 'Created at' field will be added to the admin grid.

field.label: Add 'Updated at' to admin grid
field.tooltip:
The entities created with UMC will have a field called 'updated_at' with the last update date of any entity instance.
If this is set to 'Yes' the 'Updated at' field will be added to the admin grid.

field.label: Include in admin global search
field.tooltip:
The Magento admin Global search (at the top of every admin page) searches for the text you enter in products, customers and orders.
If you set this to 'Yes' than it will search in your entity also.

field.label: Attribute Code
field.tooltip:
This is the attribute code. It will be used in the logic of the extension. Use only letters (a-z), numbers (0-9) or underscore(_) in this field, first character should be a letter.
There are some naming restriction. For example the code cannot be: 'data', 'child'

field.label: Attribute label
field.tooltip: This is the attribute label that will be visible in the back-end in the add/edit form and in some cases in frontend.

field.label: Attribute Type
field.tooltip: This is the attribute type. This wil determine the table column type for this field/attribute and its behavior.

field.label: Acts as name
field.tooltip: Each entity must have an attribute to behave as 'Name'. This attribute will be used to identify different entities among themselves. It will also be used in dropdowns with entities. This option is available only for text, number and decimal attributes.

field.label: Required
field.tooltip: This sets the attribute as required in the admin add/edit form.

field.label: Options in select
field.tooltip: If you choose to enter the values for the dropdown or multiselect manually, input them here. Separate the options with a new line.

field.label: Note
field.tooltip: This will be added as a comment under the field in the admin add/edit form.

field.label: Show in admin grid
field.tooltip: This allows you to display the attribute as a column in the admin grid of the entity. The attribute set to behave as 'Name' will be included by default in the grid.

field.label: Use WYSIWYG editor
field.tooltip: This allows you to use a WYSIWYG editor for the attribute. It is available only for Textarea attributes.

field.label: Default value
field.tooltip: Fill in a default value for the attribute. Leave empty for no value. For dropdown and multiselect attributes the value, must be a valid value. not valid ones will be removed. For the multiselect attributes add one default value on each line. For Yes/No attribtues enter 1 for Yes, 0 for No. For country attributes fill in the country ISO2 code. You cannot set a default value for image and file attributes.
field.note: One option on each row for multiple selects
